item.title: Manises UFO incident
item.description:
Manises UFO Incident ðŸ”—

This article details the Manises UFO incident, a notable UFO sighting in Spain that occurred on November 11, 1979. The incident involved a commercial flight, a Spanish Air Force jet, and unidentified objects, leading to an emergency landing and a subsequent investigation.

Incident Details ðŸ”—

This section recounts the events of the Manises UFO incident. A TAE Supercaravelle flight JK-297, carrying 109 passengers from Salzburg, Austria, to Las Palmas, experienced a close encounter with red lights while flying over Ibiza. Pilot Francisco Javier Lerdo de Tejada and his crew, unable to identify the lights and fearing a collision, made an emergency landing at Manises Airport in Valencia. Following the landing, radar detected three new UFO signals. A Spanish Air Force Mirage F1, piloted by Captain Fernando CÃ¡mara, was dispatched from Los Llanos Air Base to intercept the objects. CÃ¡mara made visual contact with a cone-shaped object, but it disappeared. He then pursued another object near Sagunto, experiencing electronic interference with his aircraft’s systems. The UFO eventually disappeared towards Africa, and CÃ¡mara, low on fuel, returned to base.

Possible Explanations ðŸ”—

This section discusses the aftermath and potential explanations for the incident. In September 1980, Enrique MÃºgica Herzog raised the issue in the Spanish Parliament, seeking an official explanation. The official report, declassified in 1994, attributed the sightings to optical illusions caused by lights from a distant chemical plant and celestial bodies. This explanation has been disputed by those involved. The report did not address the electronic malfunctions experienced by the Mirage F1. One theory suggests that the United States Sixth Fleet, conducting electronic warfare exercises during the Iran hostage crisis, might have caused the interference, but Captain CÃ¡mara dismissed this possibility.

Bibliography ðŸ”—

This section lists the books that provide further information on the Manises UFO incident:

  • Incidente en Manises by Juan JosÃ© BenÃ­tez (1980)
  • El misterio Ovni: Un alto secreto al descubierto: investigaciones y evidencias by Bruno CardeÃ±osa Chao (2010)
  • El expediente Manises by Juan Antonio FernÃ¡ndez Peris (2000)

See also ðŸ”—

This section provides a link to the “List of reported UFO sightings” page on Wikipedia.

References ðŸ”—

This section lists the sources cited in the article:

  1. Arturo Blay’s article “El piloto que persiguiÃ³ un OVNI” in Cadena SER (2015)
  2. Jaime MillÃ¡s’s article “Un “ovni” forzÃ³ el aterrizaje de un Caravelle en Manises” in El PaÃ­s (1979)
  3. Bill Cemlyn-Jones’s article “‘UFOs’ force Spanish pilot to land” in The Guardian (2015)
  4. Javier Cavanilles’s article “Caso Manises, descanse en paz” in El Mundo (2009)

External links ðŸ”—

  • Testimony of Fernando CÃ¡mara, pilot of the Mirage F1 (YouTube)
